intro: Horkelia muirii, commonly known as the Muir's horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, glandular flowers that bloom in the spring. Horkelia muirii is often found in the Sierra Nevada and other mountainous regions of California.
